Benefits: Supports bone and teeth structure, essential for energy production (ATP), involved in DNA/RNA formation, enzyme activation, and acid-base balance

Benefits: Supports heart and kidney function, muscle contraction, nerve signal transmission, fluid balance, and blood pressure regulation
Deficiency Effects: Increases blood pressure, depletes calcium in bones, raises kidney stone risk. Severe deficiency (hypokalemia) can cause fatigue, constipation, muscle weakness, high blood sugar, paralysis, irregular heartbeat, and may be life-threatening.
Natural Remedies: Dried apricots, prunes, raisins, orange juice, bananas, potatoes, spinach, tomatoes, broccoli, lentils, kidney beans, soybeans, nuts, milk, yogurt, meats, poultry, fish, salt substitutes

Benefits: Supports immune defense, enables DNA and protein synthesis, aids growth and development during pregnancy and childhood, promotes wound healing, and maintains the sense of taste
Deficiency Effects: Diarrhea, growth delays, appetite loss, frequent infections, hair loss, loss of taste and smell, delayed wound healing, cognitive issues, and complications in pregnancy like low birth weight and preterm delivery.
Natural Remedies: Oysters, crab, lobster, beef, poultry, fortified cereals, beans, nuts, whole grains, eggs, and dairy products
